definitions.sensetop: from now onby nowup till nowfor now

examples.text: Where are you living now?
They now have everything they wanted.
We now know the truth.
It's too late now.
It's been two weeks now since she called.
I can tell you **right now **that you're wrong.
I didn't receive the email but it hardly matters now.
From now on I'll be more careful.
He should be home by now.
I've lived at home up till now.
That's all for now.

definitions.definition: at or from this moment, but not before

examples.text: Start writing now.
I am now ready to answer your questions.

definitions.definition: used to show that you are annoyed about something

examples.text: Now they want to tax food!
What do you want now?
It's broken. Now I'll have to get a new one.

definitions.definition: used to get somebody’s attention before changing the subject or asking them to do something

examples.text: Now, listen to what she's saying.
Now, the next point is quite complex.
Now come and sit down.
Now let me think…
Every now and again she checked to see if he was still asleep.

definitions.definition: used when turning to a fresh activity or subject

examples.text: And now for some travel news.

definitions.definition: used to show in a mild way that you do not approve of something

examples.text: Now, now, that's enough noise.

definitions.definition: at one time… at another time…

examples.text: Her moods kept changing—now happy, now sad.

definitions.definition: this is the only opportunity somebody will have to do something
used to show in a mild way that you do not approve of something
used when making a suggestion or an offer

examples.text: Now then, who wants to come for a walk?

definitions.definition: used when you are annoyed because somebody is always asking questions or interrupting you

examples.text: ‘Yes, but Dad…’ ‘Now what?’

definitions.definition: used to say that you do not know what to do next in a particular situation

wordOrigin: Old English nū, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch nu, German nun, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin nunc and Greek nun.
